result.execSummary:
The defendant Kassandra L. Beesley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Illegal Articles to Inmate, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 302.095(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    No contact whatsoever with D. Negethon, directly or indirectly.  No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by any third party.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with the premises of any Wisconsin State Prison Institution, unless an inmate herself at that facility.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Defendant to comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Uncharged referral for Retail Theft and Bail Jumping from Winnebago County with an offense date of 10/14/2014 and Agency Case No. OP14-126002, is dismissed and read-in.

timeConds.notes:
Huber Privileges granted to the extent work release may be exercised and does not conflict with any other confinement.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence Defendant may be serving as of the date of sentencing.

records.addlTxt: 14CF-118 and 14CF-170 - Both Cases Called @ 11:18 AM: Defendant Kassandra L. Beesley in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by DA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing as to both cases.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaints as to 14CF-118 and 14CF-170.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Reading Waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.   Elements of missing element from INFO explained to Def in detail - notation made directly on INFO by Court as to 14CF118.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  14CF118 Plea Ct 1 w/o Repeater Enh:  NC  14CF170 Plea w/o Repeater Enh:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Repeater Component attached to both charges which pleas have been accepted and JOC entered - DRI.  14CF-118 Ct Nos 2 and 3 DRI.  Uncharged Referral for Retail Theft and BJump from Winnebago Co - OP14-126002 - offense date of 10/14/2014 - is also DRI.  DA makes Statement to the Court on behalf of Prison System.  Argument by DA as to penalty - 10 mos cond'l time to run concurrent.  Argument by SPD as to penalty - joins in request for 3 yrs probation.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Explains the dangerousness of what occurred within a prison system and the effects on the social structure within the institution and its implications.  14CF118:  S/W - 3 yrs probation. Conditions of Supervision:  14CF118 only - cond'l time of 8 mos WCJ - Huber to the extent it may be exercised and does not conflict with any other confinement, No TS Credit - concurrent to any existing sentence as of the present; AODA and any follow thru; Ab Sobriety; Bar Prohibition; No possess or ingest any impairing substance unless prescribed by a physician; No Contact whatsoever with D Negethon including by any electronic means or third-party; no contact whatsoever with any WI State Prison institution unless an inmate herself; any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by Supervising Agent.  Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  14CF-170 - S/W -3 yrs probation with  identical terms but for conditional jail.  Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Kassandra L. Beesley in court, in custody in FDL, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing in person.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts waiver of 20 day time limit for pre-lim hearing.  SPD confirms Def has pending charges in FDL - remains in FDL Co Jail.   ADA argues for Signature Bond in light of significant cash bond in place in FDL Co.  SPD joins in request for Signature Bond.  Discovery Demand has been filed - awaiting receipt of documents.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 03:05 pm.
